00041 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00042 #  include "config.h"
00043 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H

00045 #include <stdio.h>
00046 #include <stdlib.h>
00047 #include <stdint.h>
00048 #include <stddef.h>
00049 #include <stdbool.h>
00050 
00051 #include <string.h>
00052 #include <ctype.h>
00053 
00054 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00055 
00056 #include "nfc-utils.h"
00057 #include "mifare.h"
00058 
00059 static nfc_device *pnd;
00060 static nfc_target nt;
00061 static mifare_param mp;
00062 static mifareul_tag mtDump;
00063 static uint32_t uiBlocks = 0xF;
00064 
00065 static const nfc_modulation nmMifare = {
00066   .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00067   .nbr = NBR_106,
00068 };
00069 
00070 static void
00071 print_success_or_failure(bool bFailure, uint32_t *uiCounter)
00072 {
00073   printf("%c", (bFailure) ? 'x' : '.');
00074   if (uiCounter)
00075     *uiCounter += (bFailure) ? 0 : 1;
00076 }
00077 
00078 static  bool
00079 read_card(void)
00080 {
00081   uint32_t page;
00082   bool    bFailure = false;
00083   uint32_t uiReadedPages = 0;
00084 
00085   printf("Reading %d pages |", uiBlocks + 1);
00086 
00087   for (page = 0; page <= uiBlocks; page += 4) {
00088     // Try to read out the data block
00089     if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_READ, page, &mp)) {
00090       memcpy(mtDump.amb[page / 4].mbd.abtData, mp.mpd.abtData, 16);
00091     } else {
00092       bFailure = true;
00093       break;
00094     }
00095 
00096     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiReadedPages);
00097     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiReadedPages);
00098     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiReadedPages);
00099     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiReadedPages);
00100   }
00101   printf("|\n");
00102   printf("Done, %d of %d pages readed.\n", uiReadedPages, uiBlocks + 1);
00103   fflush(stdout);
00104 
00105   return (!bFailure);
00106 }
00107 
00108 static  bool
00109 write_card(void)
00110 {
00111   uint32_t uiBlock = 0;
00112   bool    bFailure = false;
00113   uint32_t uiWritenPages = 0;
00114   uint32_t uiSkippedPages;
00115 
00116   char    buffer[BUFSIZ];
00117   bool    write_otp;
00118   bool    write_lock;
00119 
00120   printf("Write OTP bytes ? [yN] ");
00121   if (!fgets(buffer, BUFSIZ, stdin)) {
00122     ERR("Unable to read standard input.");
00123   }
00124   write_otp = ((buffer[0] == 'y') || (buffer[0] == 'Y'));
00125   printf("Write Lock bytes ? [yN] ");
00126   if (!fgets(buffer, BUFSIZ, stdin)) {
00127     ERR("Unable to read standard input.");
00128   }
00129   write_lock = ((buffer[0] == 'y') || (buffer[0] == 'Y'));
00130 
00131   printf("Writing %d pages |", uiBlocks + 1);
00132   /* We need to skip 2 first pages. */
00133   printf("ss");
00134   uiSkippedPages = 2;
00135 
00136   for (int page = 0x2; page <= 0xF; page++) {
00137     if ((page == 0x2) && (!write_lock)) {
00138       printf("s");
00139       uiSkippedPages++;
00140       continue;
00141     }
00142     if ((page == 0x3) && (!write_otp)) {
00143       printf("s");
00144       uiSkippedPages++;
00145       continue;
00146     }
00147     // Show if the readout went well
00148     if (bFailure) {
00149       // When a failure occured we need to redo the anti-collision
00150       if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00151         ERR("tag was removed");
00152         return false;
00153       }
00154       bFailure = false;
00155     }
00156     // For the Mifare Ultralight, this write command can be used
00157     // in compatibility mode, which only actually writes the first
00158     // page (4 bytes). The Ultralight-specific Write command only
00159     // writes one page at a time.
00160     uiBlock = page / 4;
00161     memcpy(mp.mpd.abtData, mtDump.amb[uiBlock].mbd.abtData + ((page % 4) * 4), 16);
00162     if (!nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_WRITE, page, &mp))
00163       bFailure = true;
00164 
00165     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiWritenPages);
00166   }
00167   printf("|\n");
00168   printf("Done, %d of %d pages written (%d pages skipped).\n", uiWritenPages, uiBlocks + 1, uiSkippedPages);
00169 
00170   return true;
00171 }
00172 
00173 int
00174 main(int argc, const char *argv[])
00175 {
00176   bool    bReadAction;
00177   FILE   *pfDump;
00178 
00179   if (argc < 3) {
00180     printf("\n");
00181     printf("%s r|w <dump.mfd>\n", argv[0]);
00182     printf("\n");
00183     printf("r|w         - Perform read from or write to card\n");
00184     printf("<dump.mfd>  - MiFare Dump (MFD) used to write (card to MFD) or (MFD to card)\n");
00185     printf("\n");
00186     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00187   }
00188 
00189   DBG("\nChecking arguments and settings\n");
00190 
00191   bReadAction = tolower((int)((unsigned char) * (argv[1])) == 'r');
00192 
00193   if (bReadAction) {
00194     memset(&mtDump, 0x00, sizeof(mtDump));
00195   } else {
00196     pfDump = fopen(argv[2], "rb");
00197 
00198     if (pfDump == NULL) {
00199       ERR("Could not open dump file: %s\n", argv[2]);
00200       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00201     }
00202 
00203     if (fread(&mtDump, 1, sizeof(mtDump), pfDump) != sizeof(mtDump)) {
00204       ERR("Could not read from dump file: %s\n", argv[2]);
00205       fclose(pfDump);
00206       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00207     }
00208     fclose(pfDump);
00209   }
00210   DBG("Successfully opened the dump file\n");
00211 
00212   nfc_context *context;
00213   nfc_init(&context);
00214   if (context == NULL) {
00215     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00216     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00217   }
00218 
00219   // Try to open the NFC device
00220   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00221   if (pnd == NULL) {
00222     ERR("Error opening NFC device");
00223     nfc_exit(context);
00224     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00225   }
00226 
00227   if (nfc_initiator_init(pnd) < 0) {
00228     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_initiator_init");
00229     nfc_close(pnd);
00230     nfc_exit(context);
00231     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00232   }
00233 
00234   // Let the device only try once to find a tag
00235   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_INFINITE_SELECT, false) < 0) {
00236     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00237     nfc_close(pnd);
00238     nfc_exit(context);
00239     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00240   }
00241 
00242   printf("NFC device: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00243 
00244   // Try to find a MIFARE Ultralight tag
00245   if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00246     ERR("no tag was found\n");
00247     nfc_close(pnd);
00248     nfc_exit(context);
00249     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00250   }
00251   // Test if we are dealing with a MIFARE compatible tag
00252 
00253   if (nt.nti.nai.abtAtqa[1] != 0x44) {
00254     ERR("tag is not a MIFARE Ultralight card\n");
00255     nfc_close(pnd);
00256     nfc_exit(context);
00257     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00258   }
00259   // Get the info from the current tag
00260   printf("Found MIFARE Ultralight card with UID: ");
00261   size_t  szPos;
00262   for (szPos = 0; szPos < nt.nti.nai.szUidLen; szPos++) {
00263     printf("%02x", nt.nti.nai.abtUid[szPos]);
00264   }
00265   printf("\n");
00266 
00267   if (bReadAction) {
00268     if (read_card()) {
00269       printf("Writing data to file: %s ... ", argv[2]);
00270       fflush(stdout);
00271       pfDump = fopen(argv[2], "wb");
00272       if (pfDump == NULL) {
00273         printf("Could not open file: %s\n", argv[2]);
00274         nfc_close(pnd);
00275         nfc_exit(context);
00276         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00277       }
00278       if (fwrite(&mtDump, 1, sizeof(mtDump), pfDump) != sizeof(mtDump)) {
00279         printf("Could not write to file: %s\n", argv[2]);
00280         fclose(pfDump);
00281         nfc_close(pnd);
00282         nfc_exit(context);
00283         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00284       }
00285       fclose(pfDump);
00286       printf("Done.\n");
00287     }
00288   } else {
00289     write_card();
00290   }
00291 
00292   nfc_close(pnd);
00293   nfc_exit(context);
00294   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00295 }
